Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk libsemanage
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: libsemanage and policycoreutils bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description:
Updated libsemanage and policycoreutils packages that fix several bugs are now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. The libsemanage library provides an API for the manipulation of SELinux binary policies. It is used by the checkpolicy compiler and similar utilitlies, as well as by programs such as load_policy, which must perform specific transformations on binary policies, such as customizing policy Boolean settings.
The policycoreutils packages contain the core policy utilities required to manage a SELinux environment.
This update fixes the following bugs:
* In Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.3, the semodule tool did not show module versions. Consequently, tools such as Puppet, which expect module version in the output of the "semodule -l" command, stopped working or worked incorrectly. The libsemanage and semodule tools have been fixed to return a module version. If there is no module version available, "(null)" is printed. (BZ#1395733)
* Previously, the "semanage fcontext -m" operation returned "OSError: No such file or directory" and failed to modify the target file context. A patch has been applied, and the exception is handled correctly. As a result, it is possible to modify the file context with the "semanage fcontext -m" command. (BZ#1402006)
Users of libsemanage and policycoreutils are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
